function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Handling SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater samples increases the risk of exposure to the virus.","Impact":"Potential transmission of SARS-CoV-2 to individuals handling the samples and potential spread of the virus.","Mitigation":"Strict adherence to safety protocols, use of appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), and conducting sample handling in a controlled environment.","Technologies":"Biocontainment and biosafety facilities, BSL-3 facilities, and advanced sample handling and testing equipment.","People":"Researchers, laboratory technicians, and wastewater treatment workers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, and wastewater treatment facilities."},{"Description":"Lack of effective methods for the recovery of SARS-CoV-2 from wastewater increases the risk of inaccurate data and underestimation of virus presence.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of virus prevalence in communities and potential underestimation of COVID-19 cases.","Mitigation":"Continued research on effective recovery methods and development of standardized protocols for virus concentration and detection in wastewater.","Technologies":"Centrifugal filters, concentration methods using polyethylene glycol (PEG 8000), and advanced detection and quantification techniques.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, and wastewater treatment experts.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies, and wastewater treatment facilities."},{"Description":"Inadequate quantitative estimation of SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater samples may lead to misinterpretation of the virus prevalence in the community.","Impact":"Misguided public health decisions and strategies based on inaccurate estimation of virus presence in the community.","Mitigation":"Rigorous validation of quantitative estimation methods, comparison with clinical data, and continuous improvement of detection and quantification techniques.","Technologies":"RT-qPCR data analysis, concentration methods, and advanced data validation and interpretation tools.","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, and researchers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, and data analysis organizations."}]}
